CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Violation of Art. 13;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was apprehended by police officers PERSON and PERSON On DATE he was brought to the medical sobering - up facility by these officers . In the course of the applicant ’s apprehension the police officers inflicted bodily injuries on him , resulting in a short - term health disorder .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with assaulting and attempting to bribe them .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of PERSON acquitted the applicant .
CARDINAL . The applicant complained to ORG and ORG seeking to institute criminal proceedings against the police officers who had unlawfully apprehended and harmed him .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant initiated civil proceedings against the Zaporizzhia ORG in the GPE ORG of Zaporizzhia , seeking compensation for the moral damage caused by the actions of PERSON and L.G.T.
CARDINAL . NORP On DATE ORG of PERSON instituted criminal proceedings against the officers .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of Zaporizzhia sentenced B.Y.Y. and PERSON to a DATE suspended prison sentence following their conviction for abuse of power and inflicting bodily harm on the applicant . It also ordered the Zaporizzhia ORG to pay the applicant ORG in compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG upheld that decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE ORG of PERSON initiated the execution proceedings for the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the writ of execution was lodged with the GPE ORG in Zaporizzhia .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the respondent in the case was changed from ORG of PERSON to ORG of PERSON , because the latter was responsible for managing the medical sobering - up facilities .
CARDINAL . On DATE the writ of execution was transferred to the ORG for further enforcement .
CARDINAL . In DATE ORG confirmed the lack of funds of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a motion to attach the property of the NORP ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ordzhonikidze ORG of ORG informed the applicant that the attachment of the property of a ORG institution was prohibited by law .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Ordzhonikidze ORG informed the applicant of the DATE ORG lack of funds . It also stated that the latter owned no property and therefore attachment was not possible .

CARDINAL . During DATE , the applicant repeatedly lodged a number of motions with ORG , ORG , ORG , ORG of GPE and ORG , seeking to institute criminal proceedings against various officials of the DATE ORG , the execution service officials , Judge PERSON of the GPE ORG , and a private person , ORG , who had allegedly assaulted the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG terminated the proceedings in the applicant ’s case due to the lack of funds of the Zaporizzhia ORG . The Government mentioned that the applicant retained a right to reintroduce the writ of execution with ORG for DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Deputy President of ORG of GPE refused to initiate supervisory review proceedings in the applicant ’s case . It also remitted the applicant ’s claims concerning the non - execution of the judicial decision to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG issued resolution no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL concerning the institution of the enforcement proceedings for the judgment of DATE . It also proposed to the debtor that it enforce the judgment given in the applicant ’s favour voluntarily . On DATE the resolution instituting the criminal proceedings was sent to the Zaporizzhia ORG and to the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the bailiff requested ORG to transfer the funds awarded to the applicant by the judgment of CARDINAL DATE to his account .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested that the funds be transferred to his account .
CARDINAL . On DATE the judgment of CARDINAL DATE was enforced and the applicant received ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG terminated the execution proceedings in the case in view of the fact that the judgment of DATE had been enforced in full .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law is summarised in the judgment of ORG v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
